provider.description: Upload to a remote service via WFS-T
provider.name: WFS-T (Direct upload) [experimental]

providerParameter.description: Prefix to use for all CRS codes based on EPSG in geometry srsNames.
providerParameter.label: Custom EPSG prefix
providerParameter.name: crs.epsg.prefix

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default the CRS code is not modified.
valueDescriptor.sampleDescription: Make sure that all SRS names use this kind of notation. The EPSG code number is appended to the provided parameter to build the SRS name.

providerParameter.description: Target coordinate reference system the data should be transformed to.
providerParameter.label: Target CRS
providerParameter.name: crs

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default no CRS transformation is performed, the existing geometries are written with their respective CRS.
valueDescriptor.sampleDescription: Reference systems can be defined either as code or WKT (preceded with code: or wkt: respectively)

providerParameter.description: Unifiying the winding order of geometries, before writing them
providerParameter.label: Unification of winding order
providerParameter.name: geometry.unifyWindingOrder

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default, counterClockwise is set for WFS-T instance
valueDescriptor.sampleDescription: Unifying order can be set as Clockwise or no change in order (clockwise or noChange respectively).

providerParameter.description: Prefix to use for all CRS codes based on EPSG in geometry srsNames.
providerParameter.label: Custom EPSG prefix
providerParameter.name: crs.epsg.prefix

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default the CRS code is not modified.
valueDescriptor.sampleDescription: Make sure that all SRS names use this kind of notation. The EPSG code number is appended to the provided parameter to build the SRS name.

providerParameter.description: Target coordinate reference system the data should be transformed to.
providerParameter.label: Target CRS
providerParameter.name: crs

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default no CRS transformation is performed, the existing geometries are written with their respective CRS.
valueDescriptor.sampleDescription: Reference systems can be defined either as code or WKT (preceded with code: or wkt: respectively)

providerParameter.description: Unifiying the winding order of geometries, before writing them
providerParameter.label: Unification of winding order
providerParameter.name: geometry.unifyWindingOrder

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default, counterClockwise is set for GML instance
valueDescriptor.sampleDescription: Unifying order can be set as Clockwise or no change in order (clockwise or noChange respectively).

providerParameter.description: If geometries should be simplified (e.g. a MultiPolygon to a Polygon), if possible, before writing them.
providerParameter.label: Simplify geometries
providerParameter.name: gml.geometry.simplify

providerParameter.description: If the output should be pretty printed (indented)
providerParameter.label: Pretty print
providerParameter.name: xml.pretty

providerParameter.description: States if a data set feed for an INSPIRE ATOM based Download Service should be created.
providerParameter.label: Create data set feed
providerParameter.name: inspire.sds.create_feed

providerParameter.description: Title of the generated ATOM data set feed, if created.
providerParameter.label: Dataset feed title
providerParameter.name: inspire.feed.title

providerParameter.description: Subtitle of the generated ATOM data set feed, if created.
providerParameter.label: Dataset feed subtitle
providerParameter.name: inspire.feed.subtitle

providerParameter.description: Rights information for the generated ATOM data set feed, if created.
providerParameter.label: Feed rights information
providerParameter.name: inspire.feed.rights

providerParameter.description: Author name for the generated ATOM data set feed, if created.
providerParameter.label: Feed author name
providerParameter.name: inspire.feed.author_name

providerParameter.description: Author email address for the generated ATOM data set feed, if created.
providerParameter.label: Feed author email
providerParameter.name: inspire.feed.author_mail

providerParameter.description: URL the generated ATOM data set feed will be available on.
providerParameter.label: URL to dataset feed
providerParameter.name: inspire.feed.selflink

providerParameter.description: URL the GML file will be available on as part of the generated ATOM data set feed.
providerParameter.label: URL to GML file
providerParameter.name: inspire.feed.gmllink

providerParameter.description: Don't encode nilReason attributes for elements that are not nil.
providerParameter.label: Omit unnecessary nilReasons
providerParameter.name: xml.notNil.omitNilReason

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default, nilReason attributes are omitted for elements that are not nil.

providerParameter.description: Prefix to use for all CRS codes based on EPSG in geometry srsNames.
providerParameter.label: Custom EPSG prefix
providerParameter.name: crs.epsg.prefix

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default the CRS code is not modified.
valueDescriptor.sampleDescription: Make sure that all SRS names use this kind of notation. The EPSG code number is appended to the provided parameter to build the SRS name.

providerParameter.label: Target CRS
providerParameter.name: crs

providerParameter.label: Unification of winding order
providerParameter.name: geometry.unifyWindingOrder

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default, counterClockwise is set for GML instance
valueDescriptor.sampleDescription: Unifying order can be set as Clockwise or no change in order (clockwise or noChange respectively).

providerParameter.description: If geometries should be simplified (e.g. a MultiPolygon to a Polygon), if possible, before writing them.
providerParameter.label: Simplify geometries
providerParameter.name: gml.geometry.simplify

providerParameter.description: If the output should be pretty printed (indented)
providerParameter.label: Pretty print
providerParameter.name: xml.pretty

providerParameter.description: Don't encode nilReason attributes for elements that are not nil.
providerParameter.label: Omit unnecessary nilReasons
providerParameter.name: xml.notNil.omitNilReason

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default, nilReason attributes are omitted for elements that are not nil.

provider.description: Upload to a remote service via WFS-T
provider.name: WFS-T (Partitioned upload) [experimental]

providerParameter.description: Guiding value for instances per request. The number will be exceeded only in cases where there are too many interelated instances that cannot be separated.
providerParameter.label: Instances per request
providerParameter.name: instancesPerRequest

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default it will be tried to send 15000 instances per request.

providerParameter.description: Prefix to use for all CRS codes based on EPSG in geometry srsNames.
providerParameter.label: Custom EPSG prefix
providerParameter.name: crs.epsg.prefix

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default the CRS code is not modified.
valueDescriptor.sampleDescription: Make sure that all SRS names use this kind of notation. The EPSG code number is appended to the provided parameter to build the SRS name.

providerParameter.description: Target coordinate reference system the data should be transformed to.
providerParameter.label: Target CRS
providerParameter.name: crs

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default no CRS transformation is performed, the existing geometries are written with their respective CRS.
valueDescriptor.sampleDescription: Reference systems can be defined either as code or WKT (preceded with code: or wkt: respectively)

providerParameter.description: Unifiying the winding order of geometries, before writing them
providerParameter.label: Unification of winding order
providerParameter.name: geometry.unifyWindingOrder

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default, counterClockwise is set for WFS-T instance
valueDescriptor.sampleDescription: Unifying order can be set as Clockwise or no change in order (clockwise or noChange respectively).
